devdoc.author: Compound Labs, Inc.

params.key: The selector for the value to return
params.source: The verifiable author of the data

returns._0: The claimed Unix timestamp for the data and the price value (defaults to (0, 0))

params.key: The selector for the value to return
params.source: The verifiable author of the data

params.message: The payload containing the timestamp, and (key, value) pairs
params.signature: The cryptographic signature of the message payload, authorizing the source to write

source(bytes,bytes).details: Comparing to a claimed address would add nothing,  as the caller could simply perform the recover and claim that address.

params.message: The data that was presumably signed
params.signature: The fingerprint of the data + private key

returns._0: The source address which signed the message, presumably

data.details: The most recent authenticated data from all sources.  This is private because dynamic mapping keys preclude auto-generated getters.

devdoc.title: The Open Oracle Price Data Contract

get(address,string).notice: Read a single key from an authenticated source

getPrice(address,string).notice: Read only the value for a single key from an authenticated source

put(bytes,bytes).notice: Write a bunch of signed datum to the authenticated storage mapping

source(bytes,bytes).notice: Recovers the source address which signed a message

userdoc.notice: Values stored in this contract should represent a USD price with 6 decimals precision
